page.title: 01Renhold - an introduction
page.content:
The village of Renhold is spread over a length of over two miles, some three miles to the north east of Bedford. The oldest part of the village is close to the parish church and the rest was formerly made up of a number of{' ends'}like many other settlements in the county.
Again, like many others, these have tended to join up and Renhold today spreads along basically one road with hardly a break.
The function of the village has changed dramatically in the past fifty years. It has become very much a dormitory settlement for Bedford which has extended so much that the two places almost meet.
